Posts.Content: Thank you very much for the post. Does this mean that surgeries are the best options to eliminate cancer cells altogether? Chemo will always leave some cells survival. They grow back to fill up the space again. If we keep our body over all healthy, will this, at least, to limit the space for cancer tumor to grow? For example, if liver is full of healthy cells and tissue, they will compete with faulty cancer cells, although the latter grows much faster. Thanks Jing
Posts.Title: Drug resistance in oncology

Posts.Content: Thank you very much for the info. I really appreciate that you take time to answer our questions while battling your own disease. I hope that your lymphoma will get under control after the treatment. All the best, Jing
Posts.Title: Drug resistance in oncology
